reviews.review: Better than the first game in every way, great co-op a better and more funny story as well as being more challenging.

By far the best game I have ever purchased and played. Portal is a game where coopertively or solo solve increasingly harder challenges using portal guns and your brain. If you are on the fence about spending money on it, I would never pay more than 10 dollars for a game from 2011, but if there is a sale, or if you feel comfortable about it, go for it!
great

Portal 2 is an absolutely fantastic game that continues nicely off the original. With how often it is on sale on steam, I definitely would suggest picking it up and at least giving it a try. The addition of multiplayer allows you and a friend to get into all sorts of trouble together. The story is fun, interesting enough to keep you playing and gives the game a feeling of accomplishment. If you're looking for a great way to spend your time with a variety of puzzles that will make you think, this is definitely something you should try. With all the positive reviews what do you have to lose?
Words can't describe how much of a masterpiece this game is. BUY IT But only when it is $5 please.

Portal 2: A serious review. 

So if the opening line of this review caught your attention, it might be that you're like me. You wanted to read some reviews before buying this game and you quickly got fed up with most of the 'most helpful' reviews giving absolutely no real information about what the game is like. Instead, you get the feeling that anybody who's played this game has sustained permanent brain damage. To not go on any longer, here are 5 reasons why I think Portal 2 is one of the best games I've ever played.

1. Graphics: The game is beautiful! Portal (1) looked great and it was released in 2007. Portal 2 looks 10x better! The game doesn't use too many resources so an average gaming PC or laptop will run it at max settings without a problem.

2. Physics: One of the greatest elements of this game is the amazing physics. You will have great fun discovering how to use the portals and other tools supplied to navigate and solve the well thought out puzzles. The game requires you to use forward momentum, perfect timing and fast thinking (amongst many other things) to complete puzzles. There is never a dull moment.

3. Pacing: The developers has again achieved a perfect sweet spot between making the puzzles challenging but not impossible. The game starts out with a few simple puzzles that really help you understand the basics of the game and how you can best use the portals and other tools to your advantage. After that the game gradually ramps up the difficulty keeping the game challenging and fun. With some patience and perseverance you can play through this whole game without having to consult a single walkthrough.

4. Dark Humor: Portal 2 returns with more characters than Portal 1 and the scripts are again absolutely hilarious. The game treats you as what you are a test subject and the machines are as you would expect them to be, cold and calculating in carrying out their agenda. However, I have to admit that GLaDOS was funnier in Portal 1.

5. Story & Uniqueness: This game continues the surprisingly compelling story of Portal 1. I didn't think a puzzle game would have any decent kind of story but boy, was I wrong! Portal 2 is in a class of its own as an fps puzzle game that offers many hours of fun, challenging puzzles and great, hilarious scripts. My only regret is taking so long to finally play it.

P.S: these 5 points apply to both Portal (1) and Portal 2. I highly recommend you play Portal (1) first because it helps you paint a more complete picture of the full story and there are plenty of references to Portal (1) in Portal 2, including some steps in solving puzzles.

Thanks for reading. Do yourself a favor and buy this game!

Great logical game with lots of fun and creative puzzles.

Portal 1 was a bran new style of game using a new puzzle gimmick the portal.  Though while it was interesting, exciting and original, it did not feel like a complete game, but more like a demo.  Portal 2 took the ideas of the original and pushed the limits into a full fledged game.  With new puzzle items like jump panels, different gel types (i.e. speed boost and jump boost), light tunnels, a new co-op gameplay option and a much more intense storyline, this sequel sets a new standard for sequels.  The puzzles can go from absolutely simple to quite complex, but nothing too outside of the box that you will be completely stuck.  I thoroughly enjoyed this game and highly recommend it to all.
A great game to get your brain working around how to get through the various puzzles the game has to offer

Truely a unique, and extremely fun title. Generally speaking, i'm not interested in games without some kind of combat element, but Portal 2 is just such a unique concept that I couldn't pass it up, and I couldn't be happier. Seriously, even if you think you don't like puzzlers, give it a shot. I started up the single player mode, and was physically UNABLE to put it down until completion. I highly recommend this game for anyone, and everyone.

Lovely game involving puzzle-solving. Beautifully created maps. Would recommend buying it along side Portal 2, starting with Portal, then playing Portal 2, then playing the community-built maps on Portal 2. Community-built maps are very well created, I am impressed with the imagination of these creators! There are a wide range of fairly easy, but some very challenging ones! The actual game is quite short, like Portal, but there is a vast amount of community-built maps that you can spend days going through! It's also nice having Stephen Merchant keeping you company as you play!
It's quite a quick game to play through, but entertaining none-the-less.
Graphics-wise, it runs smoothly and perfectly on my early 2011 15 inch MacBook Pro.

My favorite games are the Mass Effect and Dragon Age series (can't afford Inquisition yet).  I've been struggling to find any games as engrossing and fun.  Portal 2 was wonderful.  

*The puzzles became challenging, but not to the point of pounding my head against the wall --  in other words, the difficulty level was fun through and through.  
*The storyline was extremely entertaining (though puzzles definitely took precedence)
* the dialouge was hilarious.   

If you like easy-to-difficult (non-headache-causing) problem solving, clever dialouge, and an entertaining storyline, this is a good game for you.  Now I have to buy the first one. . . .

Нет слов, как увлекательно и интересно. Пройдя одиночную игру у меня появилоь чуство печали прощаясь с GLaDOS. Мне захотелось Portal 3. Так же мне понравился сетевой режим. С друзьями это просто класс + ещё можно найти случайного игрока и поиграть с ним. Уже давно но появился режим "Мастерская Steam" где можно создавать свои камеры. Portal 2 можно сказать нельзя пройти полностью потому,что с каждым днём более 100+ новых камер от кого-нибудь. Это бесконечная прямая по которой можно идти долго и далеко. Поставил бы 10/10 ! Если кому-то  не нравится это их дела. У каждого свои вкусы.

A great sequel to the first game - Portal are the best games of Valve.
 Played it mostly for singleplayer, but it has a grand cooperative with an equally good continuation of the narrative.
If you're into co-op - you'll love it. If Portal 1 was short, Portal 2 extends replayability to infinity. Custom maps integrated with Steam Workshop is a welcome addition. The community maps allow for both singleplayer and cooperative construction.
It's a puzzle-enthusiast's dream.

This game is great, it's got to be one of the best puzzle games of all time. It has a good story line with a couple of plot twists. You might enjoy the story line a little more and appreciate parts of it if you have played the first Portal before playing this game. Plays quite well. The online co-op is pretty much seamless and works very well. It's quite fun to have a go at solving puzzles with a buddy. Overall 10/10, would believe there is cake again.

Portal 2 consegue ser um jogo incrivel, com a unica proposta de resolver puzzles, um exemplo: coloque o cubo A no ponto B, mas nesse meio tempo, vai ter uma maniaca tentando te matar de todas as formas possiveis Ó_Ó, o jogo é simples e complicado, perfeito para jogadores casuais, ainda mais os que apreciavam puzzles na velha guarda, a qualidade da trilha sonora, e da dublagem é perfeita, a melhor dublagem que ja vi na historia de todos os jogos(creditos: Ellen McLain-Glados, Stephen Merchant-Wheatley), o roteiro é fantastico, a escolha das palavras e o momento de seu uso sao perfeitos, por muitas vezes, eu me perdi e parei de jogar so para ouvir os monologos inter.minaveis e fantasticos da Glados ou do Wheatley, fisica realista e adaptavel aos inumeros e diversos puzzles, graficos bonitos e aceitaveis se tratando de um jogo de puzzle, alem de agora ter um multiplayer que é muito divertido e acrescenta algumas varias horas a o jogo e é incrivel poder matar seu amigo diversas vezes, hahahahhahahha! Compre nao pelo hipe, mas sim por que o jogo e incrivel!

EDIT 2019: É MUITA CREMOSIDADE PARA UM JOGO SÓ

Definitivamente, um clássico instantâneo.
Portal 2 deu uma sequência surpreendente ao Portal 1, superando todas as expectativas de quem esperava um jogo com desafios e bem óbvio como o Portal 1. Nessa sequência da série, pôde-se notar o esforço da Valve em desenvolver um jogo mais elaborado, com uma história envolvente e, ao mesmo tempo, com as conhecidas sequências de fases do primeiro jogo da série - só que, desta vez, com algumas surpresas ao longo das sequências.
This is the best game I own. No explanation necessary.
